source: U.S. Department of Labor - O*NET Database
description: Enduring attributes of the individual that influence performance

cognitive.name: Cognitive Abilities
cognitive.description: Abilities that influence the acquisition and application of knowledge in problem solving

abilities.name: Oral Comprehension
abilities.definition: The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

abilities.name: Written Comprehension
abilities.definition: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

abilities.name: Oral Expression
abilities.definition: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

abilities.name: Written Expression
abilities.definition: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.

abilities.name: Fluency of Ideas
abilities.definition: The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

abilities.name: Originality
abilities.definition: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.

abilities.name: Problem Sensitivity
abilities.definition: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.

abilities.name: Deductive Reasoning
abilities.definition: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

abilities.name: Inductive Reasoning
abilities.definition: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).

abilities.name: Information Ordering
abilities.definition: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).

abilities.name: Category Flexibility
abilities.definition: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways.

abilities.name: Mathematical Reasoning
abilities.definition: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

abilities.name: Number Facility
abilities.definition: The ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and correctly.

abilities.name: Memorization
abilities.definition: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, and procedures.

abilities.name: Speed of Closure
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.

abilities.name: Flexibility of Closure
abilities.definition: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern (a figure, object, word, or sound) that is hidden in other distracting material.

abilities.name: Perceptual Speed
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns.

abilities.name: Spatial Orientation
abilities.definition: The ability to know your location in relation to the environment or to know where other objects are in relation to you.

abilities.name: Visualization
abilities.definition: The ability to imagine how something will look after it is moved around or when its parts are moved or rearranged.

abilities.name: Selective Attention
abilities.definition: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

abilities.name: Time Sharing
abilities.definition: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information (such as speech, sounds, touch, or other sources).

psychomotor.name: Psychomotor Abilities
psychomotor.description: Abilities that influence the capacity to manipulate and control objects

abilities.name: Arm-Hand Steadiness
abilities.definition: The ability to keep your hand and arm steady while moving your arm or while holding your arm and hand in one position.

abilities.name: Manual Dexterity
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly move your hand, your hand together with your arm, or your two hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble objects.

abilities.name: Finger Dexterity
abilities.definition: The ability to make precisely coordinated movements of the fingers of one or both hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble very small objects.

abilities.name: Control Precision
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly and repeatedly adjust the controls of a machine or a vehicle to exact positions.

abilities.name: Multilimb Coordination
abilities.definition: The ability to coordinate two or more limbs (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while sitting, standing, or lying down. It does not involve performing the activities while the whole body is in motion.

abilities.name: Response Orientation
abilities.definition: The ability to choose quickly between two or more movements in response to two or more different signals (lights, sounds, pictures). It includes the speed with which the correct response is started with the hand, foot, or other body part.

abilities.name: Rate Control
abilities.definition: The ability to time your movements or the movement of a piece of equipment in anticipation of changes in the speed and/or direction of a moving object or scene.

abilities.name: Reaction Time
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly respond (with the hand, finger, or foot) to a signal (sound, light, picture) when it appears.

abilities.name: Wrist-Finger Speed
abilities.definition: The ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists.

abilities.name: Speed of Limb Movement
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly move the arms and legs.

physical.name: Physical Abilities
physical.description: Abilities that influence strength, endurance, flexibility, balance and coordination

abilities.name: Static Strength
abilities.definition: The ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects.

abilities.name: Explosive Strength
abilities.definition: The ability to use short bursts of muscle force to propel oneself (as in jumping or sprinting), or to throw an object.

abilities.name: Dynamic Strength
abilities.definition: The ability to exert muscle force repeatedly or continuously over time. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue.

abilities.name: Trunk Strength
abilities.definition: The ability to use your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time without 'giving out' or fatiguing.

abilities.name: Stamina
abilities.definition: The ability to exert yourself physically over long periods of time without getting winded or out of breath.

abilities.name: Extent Flexibility
abilities.definition: The ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms, and/or legs.

abilities.name: Dynamic Flexibility
abilities.definition: The ability to quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out with your body, arms, and/or legs.

abilities.name: Gross Body Coordination
abilities.definition: The ability to coordinate the movement of your arms, legs, and torso together when the whole body is in motion.

abilities.name: Gross Body Equilibrium
abilities.definition: The ability to keep or regain your body balance or stay upright when in an unstable position.

sensory.name: Sensory Abilities
sensory.description: Abilities that influence visual, auditory and speech perception

abilities.name: Near Vision
abilities.definition: The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).

abilities.name: Far Vision
abilities.definition: The ability to see details at a distance.

abilities.name: Visual Color Discrimination
abilities.definition: The ability to match or detect differences between colors, including shades of color and brightness.

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.definition: The ability to see under low light conditions.

abilities.name: Peripheral Vision
abilities.definition: The ability to see objects or movement of objects to one's side when the eyes are looking ahead.

abilities.name: Depth Perception
abilities.definition: The ability to judge which of several objects is closer or farther away from you, or to judge the distance between you and an object.

abilities.name: Glare Sensitivity
abilities.definition: The ability to see objects in the presence of glare or bright lighting.

abilities.name: Hearing Sensitivity
abilities.definition: The ability to detect or tell the differences between sounds that vary in pitch and loudness.

abilities.name: Auditory Attention
abilities.definition: The ability to focus on a single source of sound in the presence of other distracting sounds.

abilities.name: Sound Localization
abilities.definition: The ability to tell the direction from which a sound originated.

abilities.name: Speech Recognition
abilities.definition: The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.

abilities.name: Speech Clarity
abilities.definition: The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.
